decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed TFL-0000-01 WAND 21; TFL-0000-05-01; TFL-0000-06-T; TFL-0000-10-T. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 3 - In the event that the vehicle charging point and associated equipment ceases or alters in a manner so as to leave this structure without function as indicated within approved documents, then the structures shall be removed in their entirety and the land made good to the same condition as the adjacent land within 3 months of the cessation of the use of the structure. 
Reason: To prevent the retention of redundant equipment in public realm in order to ensure no long term harm to the appearance, amenity and public safety of the location in accordance with Council Policies LP1 and LP2 of the Wandsworh Local Plan.
Condition : 4 - The plant hereby permitted shall be installed in strict accordance with the submitted details. The plant shall thereafter be retained as approved.
The cumulative measured or calculated rating level of noise emitted from the plant shall be 5dB(A) below the existing background noise level, at all times that the plant operates. The measured or calculated noise levels shall be determined at the boundary of the nearest ground floor noise sensitive premises or 1 metre form the facade of the nearest first floor (or higher) noise sensitive premises, and in accordance with the latest British Standard 4142. 
Reason: To protect residential amenity of neighbouring properties in  accordance with Council policies LP2 and LP14 of the Wandsworth Local Plan.
Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
description: Installation of electric vehicle charging infrastructure on the carriageway.
